item.title: Sam add a quote by Tony Blair
item.description: "A simple way to take measure of a country is to look at how many want in.. And how many want out." -- Tony Blair

item.title: Sam add a quote by Ronald Reagan
item.description: "I have left orders to be awakened at any time during national emergency, even if I'm in a cabinet meeting." -- Ronald Reagan

item.title: Sam add a quote by Thomas Sowell
item.description: "Economics is a study of cause-and-effect relationships in an economy. It's purpose is to discern the consequences of various ways of allocating resources which have alternative uses. It has nothing to say about philosophy or values, anymore than it has to say about music or literature." -- Thomas Sowell

item.title: Sam add a quote by Ecclesiastes 9:11
item.description: "The race is not to the swift, nor the battle to the strong, neither yet bread to the wise, nor yet riches to men of understanding, nor yet favour to men of skill; but time and chance happeneth to them all. " -- Ecclesiastes 9:11

item.title: Sam add a quote by Abraham Lincoln
item.description: "When I do good, I feel good. When I do bad, I feel bad. That's my religion." -- Abraham Lincoln

item.title: Sam add a quote by G.K. Chesterton
item.description: "Poets have been mysteriously silent on the subject of cheese." -- G.K. Chesterton

item.title: Sam add a quote by G.K. Chesterton
item.description: "The poet only asks to get his head into the heavens. It is the logician who seeks to get the heavens into his head. And it is his head that splits." -- G.K. Chesterton

item.title: Sam add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "Fairy tales are more than true: not because they tell us that dragons exist, but because they tell us that dragons can be beaten." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Sam add a quote by Dean Koontz
item.description: "Language can't describe reality. Literature has no stable reference, no real meaning. Each reader's interpretation is equally valid, more important than the author's intention. In fact, nothing in life has meaning. Reality is subjective. Values and truths are subjective. Life itself is a kind of illusion. Blah, blah, blah, let's have another scotch." -- Dean Koontz

item.title: Sam add a quote by Dean Koontz
item.description: "Life is a train ride, and at the many stations along the route, people important to us debark, never to get aboard again, until by the end of the journey, we sit in a passenger car where most of the seats are empty." -- Dean Koontz
